intro: Mesembryanthemum neilii, commonly known as the Natal carpet or Natal daisies, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant, daisy-like flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained sandy soils and prefers full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink and yellow, bloom in late spring to early summer, adding a striking visual display to gardens. Mesembryanthemum neilii is also valued for its drought tolerance and ability to thrive in arid environments.
